Research Interests: | Jeremy Siegel     | Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania | Preference for index funds, skepticism towards bonds, focus on dividends | Born November 14, 1945; Ph.D. from MIT; Best Business School Professor (1994); Nicholas Molodovsky Award (2005) | Jeremy Siegel is an American economist and the Russell E. Palmer Professor of Finance at the Wharton School. He is known for his investing theories, particularly advocating for long-term stock investments over bonds. Siegel has authored several influential books, including "Stocks for the Long Run" and "The Future for Investors." He has also contributed significantly to financial media discussions. | [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeremy_Siegel) |
